title: RNC: The future for Republicans, and America, has never looked brighter
text:
While Republicans are reviving, Democrats are rebranding as the party of socialists, radicals and rioters: Opposing view

Republicans are told we must denounce other Republicans for the “good of the party.” Call us skeptical that Democrats and the media have our best interests at heart. There is a reason President Donald Trump enjoys over 90% approval among Republicans: He is doing exactly what he said he would.

“In America, the people rule again,” President Trump said recently. It’s about time.

Our votes in 2016 rejected career politicians who gave lip service to our concerns but, once in office, forgot who put them there. The president is doing something novel in politics: keeping his promises. Whether it’s securing our border, holding China accountable, rebuilding our military, negotiating great trade deals or ushering in the best economy in the world, he is delivering.

These unprecedented victories for all Americans come despite hostile Democratic obstructionists working with swamp saboteurs in futile attempts to overturn our votes.

It took an outsider unbeholden to the political class to bring real change. President Trump has confidence not only to fight an establishment resistant to change, but confidence in America.

America is no longer to be apologized for, where elites who never created a single job told us our jobs were gone. What we had? We “didn’t build that.” It was always what we can’t do. Now, it’s what can’t we do. A “limitless frontier.”

OUR VIEW: Forget Donald Trump, Republicans. Save the GOP for the sake of your party's future.

A rally on Oct. 9, 2019, in West Jordan, Utah. (Photo: Rick Bowmer/AP)

This revival of the American can-do spirit coincides with a restoration of values, protecting free speech, religious liberty, the unborn, the national defense and putting America first.

Meanwhile, Democrats are putting America last, trampling the Constitution in a stampede to the left.

While Republicans are reviving, Democrats are rebranding as the party of socialists, radicals and rioters.

A platform of gun confiscation, taxpayer-fundedabortion up until birth, socialized medicine, welfare for illegal immigrants and “reshaping” capitalism doesn’t portend longevity.

What does? Over 150 originalist judges on the federal bench and a historically low unemployment rate are a good start.

The future for Republicans, and America, has never looked brighter.

Liz Harrington is national spokesperson for the Republican National Committee.
